Creating a safer environment together, for your digital transactions with #Singpass! 

Singpass is your trusted and secure digital identity for everyday digital transactions. More importantly, it is the key to your personal and sensitive information. 

In the past year, Singpass has introduced a series of measures to enhance protections for your account. 

Learn more about these below, and how you can play a part in safeguarding your Singpass account! Stay tuned for Part 2. 

Visit go.gov.sg/even-safer-singpass for more information. 

#EvenBetterSingpass #CyberSG #DigitalIdentity #TechForPublicGood #GovTechSG

Let us bring you through GovTechâ€™s A11y Week that happened last week! ğŸ™Œ

A11y Week, organised by our Accessibility Enabling Team (A11y Team) in our Government Digital Services Division, is an annual learning festival for all public officers to explore what it means to design accessible and inclusive digital services for everyone in Singapore.

Public officers from over 80 agencies attended a series of educational physical workshops and virtual talks that put the spotlight on different forms of non-standard communication. In the workshops, participants got to experience the impact of inaccessible digital services first-hand, learned how to scan their agency websites for accessibility issues, and explored how we can all take actionable steps to support Persons with Disabilities through our work and in our daily lives. 
 
Join us as we journey to build more #TechForPublicGood ğŸ¤—

#Accessibility #Inclusivity #A11yWeekSG2023 #SmartNation #UX #Engineering #GovTechSG

Providing equal access to technology is something the Singapore Government is committed to. ğŸ’ªâ£
 â£
At GovTech, our Accessibility Enabling Team (A11y Team) organises an annual A11y Week to raise awareness of inclusivity and accessibility in digital products. Public officers from across the Service attended talks and workshops over the 3-day learning festival.â£
 â£
Our speakers this year - spanning people, public, and private sectors - delved into approaching inclusive communication at the organisational, community, and personal levels. They also dived deeper into what we can do to further our inclusion efforts as a digital government ğŸ¤—â£
